replies.bodyText:
Hey @Pablete1234,
I want to keep all the tool names as separate colors, the observer tool is already Aqua. Do you have any recommendations? Perhaps bolded white or would you rather I swap the colors between the observer tools and this?
replies.author: applenick

replies.bodyText: I’m marking this as resolved, please check my most recent comment below for the new format. I think it looks better than dark aqua. Let me know if you agree.
replies.author: applenick

timeline.bodyText: This should probably be in ObserverToolFactory / Observing
timeline.author: KingOfSquares

replies.bodyText: @KingOfSquares I understand your idea, however that would break convention. Any tool that has built in functionality (picker, observer tools) is created in the match module where the related functionality is located. Were this featured handled outside of PGM then yeah it would be located there. Thanks for the suggestion though 😄
replies.author: applenick

timeline.author: KingOfSquares

timeline.bodyText: I believe you can just cancel PlayerBucketEvent instead of both fill and empty?
timeline.author: KingOfSquares

replies.bodyText: Good idea! I’ll test that out and let you know.
replies.author: applenick

replies.bodyText: Ok it’s really weird but the PlayerBucketEvent caused a lot of headaches for an hour. For some reason it caused an issue where players were unable to join the server at all. So I’m just going to keep the separate events.
replies.author: applenick

timeline.bodyText:
Same for this, why not just cancel all InventoryEvents, that way to can also cancel events like InventoryOpenEvent and opening other interfaces like Anvils, Crafting tables..
EDIT: My bad, InventoryEvents dont directly relate to a player it seems. But you can maybe stop InventoryOpenEvent at least?
timeline.author: KingOfSquares

replies.bodyText: @KingOfSquares Good thinking, however I think it’s fine to allow the inventory open event. Let’s say a moderator is questioning the contents of the frozen player’s inventory, it may be useful to allow the user to open up their inventory and see. Plus with the inventory click blocking it, they can’t edit it anyway.
replies.author: applenick

replies.bodyText: @KingOfSquares Also just checked, InventoryEvent is not cancellable either.
replies.author: applenick

timeline.bodyText: This should maybe be placed together with the other VeichleEvents? And why not just cancel all VehicleEvents? :p
